value.title: Amnesty International calls for ban on facial recognition
value.excerpt: As advocates for facial recognition tout the tech’s potential to track down the US Capitol rioters, a new Amnesty International campaign has provided a timely reminder of the software’s dangers.

value.title: Designing An Electric Or Autonomous Vehicle Is Like Designing A Smartphone
value.excerpt: Smartphones require the latest technology to increase device functionality and to improve system efficiency to prolong battery life. EVs and AVs face similar challenges.

value.title: Trinamix unveils 3D imaging to stop facial-recognition theft on smartphones
value.excerpt: Trinamix is introducing a 3D imaging solution that helps prevent fraud when someone tries to log into a system using facial recognition.

value.title: Snap acquired Ariel AI, a computer vision startup set up by ex-Facebook and Google scientists
value.excerpt: Two of Ariel AI's three cofounders worked at Facebook and Google as research scientists.

value.title: Computer vision researchers develop city-scale smart tracking platform
value.excerpt: Tracking a vehicle or person moving between multiple city-scale locations will become considerably easier thanks to AI camera innovations.

value.excerpt: According to Gartner, 58% of marketing leaders believe brand is a critical driver of buyer behavior for prospects, and 65% believe it’s a critical driver of buyer behavior for existing customers. value.title: A scary proposal to use facial recognition and AI by an Indian state has experts fuming
value.excerpt: The Lucknow police are installing cameras with facial recognition technology, powered by artificial intelligence (AI), in prominent harassment hotspots. The cameras will gauge whether a woman is in distress based on her facial expression and send an alert to the police.

value.title: Staten Island DA Draws Criticism for Facial Recognition Use
value.excerpt: Critics argue the technology from Clearview AI treads on basic privacy and civil rights by collecting and storing data on individuals pulled from social media and Internet channels without their knowledge or consent.

value.title: Privacy fears as Indian city Lucknow readies facial recognition to spot harassed women
value.excerpt: Concerns that technology will lead to intrusive policing and privacy violations, digital rights experts warned.

value.title: Minneapolis a step closer to banning facial recognition technology
value.excerpt: There are concerns about it leading to a surveillance state, and that it could harm disadvantaged communities.

value.title: Ban on facial recognition technology by Minneapolis police advances
value.excerpt: A proposal to ban the use of facial recognition technology by Minneapolis police and other city departments is advancing. A council committee advanced the measure Thursday which will go to the full council Feb.

value.title: Sen. Sherrod Brown files ethics complaint against Ted Cruz, Josh Hawley
value.excerpt: Sen. Sherrod Brown of Ohio has joined several Democrats in filing a Senate Ethics Committee complaint against Republican Senators Ted Cruz and Josh Hawley.

value.title: AI in Computer Vision Technology and the Impact on Healthcare
value.excerpt: In this episode of Impetus Digital’s Fireside Chat, Moshe Safran, CEO at RSIP Vision USA discusses a range of topics related to computer vision, AI, and deep learning in medical imaging, surgery, and healthcare, including the work that RSIP Vision is doing in these fields.

value.title: This Site Published Every Face From Parler's Capitol Riot Videos
value.excerpt: Faces of the Riot used open source software to detect, extract, and deduplicate every face from the 827 videos taken from the insurrection on January 6.

value.title: Technologists Use Facial Recognition on Parler Videos
value.excerpt: Technologists have used facial recognition techniques on the large archive of Parler videos filmed from the January 6 Capitol riots, Motherboard has learned. In some cases they have been able to track individual faces across different videos,

value.title: Facebook updates its automatic alternative text system with expanded object recognition
value.excerpt: The next-generation AAT system can identify more objects in photos, perceive where each object is located relative to each other and provide more detailed descriptions.

value.title: Facebook AI Gets Better at Describing Photos for Visually Impaired Users
value.excerpt: In an effort to better accommodate users who are blind or visually impaired, Facebook this week updated its automatic alternative text (AAT) technology. The feature, introduced in 2016 (and granted the Helen Keller Achievement Award from the American Foundation for the Blind in 2018),

value.title: Facebook uses AI to improve photo descriptions for the visually impaired
value.excerpt: One of the most common types of content shared on Facebook, and other social media platforms are photographs. While most social media users can look at an image and see what it represents,

value.title: Apple patents next gen Face ID, which uses facial heat mapping
value.excerpt: Apple has just been granted a new patent that is related to its Face ID biometric security system. The patent details a next gen advancement in facial recognition technology, which apparently uses facial heat mapping for authentication.

value.title: RSIP Vision Announces Versatile Medical Image Segmentation Tool, Delivering Efficient Anatomical Measurements and Better Treatment Options
value.excerpt: Jan 19, 2021-- RSIP Vision, a leading innovator in medical imaging through advanced AI and computer vision solutions, today announces a general purpose, AI-based segmentation and measurement tool for detecting objects of interest and their boundaries quickly and automatically,

value.title: Twenty20 Solutions introduces edge AI face biometrics and object recognition
value.excerpt: Twenty20 Solutions is now able to provide cutting-edge face biometrics and object recognition solutions powered by advanced machine learning methods.

value.title: Opinion: Facial Recognition Vital to Nab Capitol Assailants
value.excerpt: While cities ranging from San Francisco to Boston have worked to ban facial recognition outright, without that technology, the FBI and Capitol Police would have had a harder job arresting the Capitol insurrectionists.

value.title: Google launches suite of AI-powered solutions for retailers
value.excerpt: Google's new Product Discovery Solutions for Retail aims to address ecommerce challenges during the pandemic with AI and machine learning.

value.title: Delhi airport evaluating 'computer vision' tech to track flyers, ensure social distancing: Official
value.excerpt: Delhi airport, which is also led by a GMR group-headed consortium, installed the 'Xovis' passenger tracking system at Terminal 3 last month

value.title: Delhi Airport evaluating 'computer vision' technology to track passengers: CEO
value.excerpt: Delhi Airport is evaluating computer vision technology to track passengers, reduce waiting time and ensure social distancing at terminals, a top official of the facility's operator informed | NewsByte

value.title: US lawmakers aims to curtail face recognition
value.excerpt: Microsoft and Amazon halted facial recognition sales to police this month following nationwide protests that have demanded an end to law enforcement tactics that unfairly target African Americans and other minorities.

value.title: U.S. lawmakers aim to curtail face recognition even as the technology IDs Capitol attackers
value.excerpt: U.S. lawmakers are moving ahead with efforts to ban facial recognition software even as the technology helps identify supporters of President Donald Trump who ransacked their workplace and forced them to evacuate this month.
